title: Feature : Still missing Right Mouse - SETTINGS change
author: TwobrainsOne
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
simple : on a connection option, right-mouse click and have in the menu the option to open the CONENCTION SETTINGS.

## Current Behavior
not available in current menu, only via a  BUTTON as (floating Window) for all connections.

## Possible Solution
Support this !

iterations.description: The user is requesting access to application Settings (likely global Options) directly from the connection tree context menu, which is currently missing.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The user is requesting access to application Settings (likely global Options) directly from the connection tree context menu, which is currently missing.
Approach: Add an 'Options' menu item to the connection tree context menu that opens the application settings dialog via AppWindows.Show(WindowType.Options).
